awd_titl_txt: Study of Ultra High Energy Phenomena Using Tevatron Colliderand Cosmic Rays (Physics)
awd_abstract_narration: The work is in the fields of both elementary particle                      physics, (EPP) and astrophysics (AP), and the intersection of                   both fields as well.  The EPP work measures the elastic                         scattering and total cross sections for proton-antiproton                       interactions at 2 TeV at the Fermilab Collider (the highest                     energy accelerator in the world).  There are two cosmic ray                     projects, one at Los Alamos which searches for point sources of                 cosmic rays with energies greater than 30 TeV and one project                   to study neutrino astronomy.                                                         The EPP field studies the basic building blocks of matter                  (e.g., electrons, positrons, quarks, and weak bosons) at very                   high energies.  The experiments use accelerators (colliders)                    which provide the highest energy particles made in the                          laboratory.  The data is collected and analyzed using highly                    complex and sophisticated apparatus and techniques.  The AP                     field studies the origins and structure of the universe by                      measuring radiation impinging on the earth from outer space.                    The measurement of this radiation gives information about AP                    and EPP.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
